wtUrlParse ( $  url,
$  defaults = NULL 
)

Parses an URL.

The URL may consist of: protocol, user,password, host, port, path, query and anchor. Example: http://user:pass@yourhost.org:8800/path/to/index.php?querystring=here#anchor Result: Array ( [protocol] => http [user] => user [password] => pass [host] => yourhost.org [port] => 8800 [path] => /path/to/index.php [query] => querystring=here [anchor] => anchor )

Parameters:
$url The url to parse.
Optional. If a certain component is missing in the URL, a default value can be defined here. The input format equals the output of this function (an associative array with URL component keys).
Returns:
An associative array containing the result.
